Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Gestational Hypertension on Offspring Seizure Risk

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation occurred at the cohort level

Participants.evidence: Participants included children born to mothers with or without GH

Intervention.evidence: Participants included children born to mothers with or without GH

Objective.evidence: This study aims to explore the association between GH and seizure risk in children.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of seizures in offspring, assessed up to 18 years of age.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation occurred at the cohort level, with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Analysis of the Epic Cosmos dataset revealed a higher seizure incidence in children of mothers with GH (OR 1.22; 95% CI: 1.21â€“1.23, P < 0.001).
